items.name: addCssClass(className)
items.description: Apply a CSS class to the date picker.

items.name: addRange(start, end)
items.description: Add a selectable range. Use Date instances or numbers(timestamp).

examples.code: const start = new Date(2015, 1, 3); const end = new Date(2015, 2, 6); datepicker.addRange(start, end);

items.name: change
items.description: Occur after the selected date is changed.
sees: Refer to CustomEvents from tui-code-snippet for more methods. DatePicker mixes in the methods from CustomEvents.

examples.code: // bind the 'change' event datepicker.on('change', () => { console.log(`Selected date: ${datepicker.getDate()}`); }); // unbind the 'change' event datepicker.off('change');

items.name: changeLanguage(language)
sees: To set to the other languages, use DatePicker.localeTexts.

params.name: language
params.description: Language code. English('en') and Korean('ko') are provided as default.

items.name: close
items.description: Occur after the date picker closes.
sees: Refer to CustomEvents from tui-code-snippet for more methods. DatePicker mixes in the methods from CustomEvents.

examples.code: // bind the 'close' event datepicker.on('close', () => { alert('close'); }); // unbind the 'close' event datepicker.off('close');

params.name: wrapperElement
params.description: Container element or selector of the Calendar

params.name: options
params.description: Calendar options. Refer to the Calendar instance's options.

examples.code: const calendar = DatePicker.createCalendar('#calendar-wrapper', { language: 'en', showToday: true, showJumpButtons: false, date: new Date(), type: 'date' });

params.name: options
params.description: DateRangePicker options. Refer to the DateRangePicker instance's options.

examples.code: const rangepicker = DatePicker.createRangePicker({ startpicker: { input: '#start-input', container: '#start-container' }, endpicker: { input: '#end-input', container: '#end-container' }, type: 'date', format: 'yyyy-MM-dd' selectableRanges: [ [new Date(2017, 3, 1), new Date(2017, 5, 1)], [new Date(2017, 6, 3), new Date(2017, 10, 5)] ] });

items.name: draw
items.description: Occur after the calendar is drawn.
sees: Refer to CustomEvents from tui-code-snippet for more methods. DatePicker mixes in the methods from CustomEvents.

examples.code: // bind the 'draw' event datepicker.on('draw', (event) => { console.log(`Draw the ${event.type} calendar and its date is ${event.date}.`); }); // unbind the 'draw' event datepicker.off('draw');

items.name: drawLowerCalendar(date)
items.description: Lower the calendar type. (year -> month -> date)

items.name: drawUpperCalendar(date)
items.description: Raise the calendar type. (date -> month -> year)

items.name: findOverlappedRange(startDate, endDate)
items.description: Return the first overlapped range from the point or range.

params.name: startDate
params.description: Start date to find overlapped range

params.name: endDate
params.description: End date to find overlapped range

examples.code: // 2015-04-13 datepicker.getDate(); // new Date(2015, 3, 13)

items.name: getDateElements()
items.description: Return the date elements on the calendar.

examples.code: const timePicker = this.getTimePicker();

items.name: isDisabled()
items.description: Return whether the date picker is disabled

items.name: isOpened()
items.description: Return whether the datepicker opens or not

examples.code: datepicker.close(); datepicker.isOpened(); // false datepicker.open(); datepicker.isOpened(); // true

items.name: isSelectable(date)
items.description: Return whether the date is selectable.

items.name: isSelected(date)
items.description: Return whether the date is selected.

items.name: localeTexts
items.description: Locale text data. English('en') and Korean('ko') are provided as default.

examples.code: DatePicker.localeTexts['customKey'] = { titles: { // days DD: ['Sunday', 'Monday', 'Tuesday', 'Wednesday', 'Thursday', 'Friday', 'Saturday'], // daysShort D: ['Sun', 'Mon', 'Tue', 'Wed', 'Thu', 'Fri', 'Sat'], // months MMMM: [ 'January', 'February', 'March', 'April', 'May', 'June', 'July', 'August', 'September', 'October', 'November', 'December' ], // monthsShort MMM: ['Jan', 'Feb', 'Mar', 'Apr', 'May', 'Jun', 'Jul', 'Aug', 'Sep', 'Oct', 'Nov', 'Dec'] }, titleFormat: 'MMM yyyy', todayFormat: 'D, MMMM dd, yyyy', date: 'Date', time: 'Time' }; const datepicker = new DatePicker('#datepicker-container', { language: 'customKey' });

params.name: container
params.description: Container element or selector of DatePicker

properties.name: date
properties.description: Initial date. Set by a Date instance or a number(timestamp). (default: no initial date)

properties.name: type
properties.description: DatePicker type. Determine whether to choose a date, month, or year.

properties.name: language
properties.description: Language code. English('en') and Korean('ko') are provided as default. To set to the other languages, use DatePicker.localeTexts.

properties.name: timePicker
properties.description: TimePicker options. Refer to the TimePicker instance's options. To create the TimePicker without customization, set to true.

properties.name: calendar
properties.description: Calendar options. Refer to the Calendar instance's options.

properties.name: selectableRanges
properties.description: Ranges of selectable date. Set by Date instances or numbers(timestamp).

properties.name: openers
properties.description: List of the openers to open the DatePicker (example - icon, button, etc.)

properties.name: autoClose
properties.description: Close the DatePicker after clicking the date

properties.name: usageStatistics
properties.description: Send a hostname to Google Analytics (default: true)

properties.name: weekStartDay
properties.description: Start of the week. 'Sun', 'Mon', ..., 'Sat'(default: 'Sun'(start on Sunday))

examples.code: // ES6 import DatePicker from 'tui-date-picker' // CommonJS const DatePicker = require('tui-date-picker'); // Browser const DatePicker = tui.DatePicker; const range1 = [new Date(2015, 2, 1), new Date(2015, 3, 1)]; const range2 = [1465570800000, 1481266182155]; // timestamps const picker1 = new DatePicker('#datepicker-container1', { showAlways: true }); const picker2 = new DatePicker('#datepicker-container2', { showAlways: true, timePicker: true }); const picker3 = new DatePicker('#datepicker-container3', { language: 'ko', calendar: { showToday: true }, timePicker: { showMeridiem: true, defaultHour: 13, defaultMinute: 24 }, input: { element: '#datepicker-input', format: 'yyyy MM dd hh:mm A' } type: 'date', date: new Date(2015, 0, 1) selectableRanges: [range1, range2], openers: ['#opener'], weekStartDay: 'Mon', });

items.name: open
items.description: Occur after the date picker opens.
sees: Refer to CustomEvents from tui-code-snippet for more methods. DatePicker mixes in the methods from CustomEvents.

examples.code: // bind the 'open' event datepicker.on('open', () => { alert('open'); }); // unbind the 'open' event datepicker.off('open');
datepicker.open();

items.name: removeCssClass(className)
items.description: Remove a CSS class from the date picker.

items.name: removeRange(start, end, type)
items.description: Remove a range. Use Date instances or numbers(timestamp).

params.name: type
params.description: Range type. If falsy, start and end values are considered as timestamp

examples.code: const start = new Date(2015, 1, 3); const end = new Date(2015, 2, 6); datepicker.removeRange(start, end);

params.name: date
params.description: Date instance or timestamp to set

examples.code: datepicker.setDate(new Date()); // Set today

items.name: setDateFormat(format)
items.description: Select the date by the date string format.

examples.code: datepicker.setDateFormat('yyyy-MM-dd'); datepicker.setDateFormat('MM-dd, yyyy'); datepicker.setDateFormat('yy/M/d'); datepicker.setDateFormat('yy/MM/dd');

properties.name: format
properties.description: Format of the Date string in the input

properties.name: syncFromInput
properties.description: Whether set the date from the input

items.name: setNull()
items.description: Set no date to be selected. (Selected date: null)

items.name: setRanges(ranges)
items.description: Set selectable ranges. Previous ranges will be removed.

params.name: ranges
params.description: Selectable ranges. Use Date instances or numbers(timestamp).

examples.code: datepicker.setRanges([ [new Date(2017, 0, 1), new Date(2018, 0, 2)], [new Date(2015, 2, 3), new Date(2016, 4, 2)] ]);
datepicker.setType('month');
datepicker.toggle();
